physical_appearance:This is a clipping from the periodical publication \u0027The Orient Illustrated Weekly.\u0027 This page features the tricoloured flag of India of India Saffron
 white and green in the center. It is titled \u0027The Flag of Freedom.\u0027 At the bottom of the clipping
 the text reads three four-lined poems that calls for freedom of the nation. The edges of the page are slightly torn.

sgcool_label_text:\Prior to the World War II period
 Indians in Singapore and Malaya retained strong political
 sentimental and economic ties with their home country. Anti-colonial thoughts and actions
 inspired by the \\call for freedom\\ in India

metadata.title_text: The Orient Weekly The Flag of Freedom
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a clipping from the periodical publication 'The Orient Illustrated Weekly.' This page features the tricoloured flag of India of India Saffron, white and green in the center. It is titled 'The Flag of Freedom.' At the bottom of the clipping, the text reads three four-lined poems that calls for freedom of the nation. The edges of the page are slightly torn.
metadata.subject_terms_2: self-determination, national Nationalism Anti-imperialist movements Flags Indian National Army Periodicals
metadata.subject_terms_3: Indian National Army (Singapore) Indian National Army Monument Site periodicals
metadata.sgcool_label_text: "Prior to the World War II period, Indians in Singapore and Malaya retained strong political, sentimental and economic ties with their home country. Anti-colonial thoughts and actions, inspired by the ""call for freedom"" in India
